titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Gianfranco Sanguinetti Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:03

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of correspondence, writings, notes, clippings, photocopies, posters, printed materials, legal papers, photographs, and digital media documenting the life and work of writer Gianfranco Sanguinetti. Correspondence with Guy Debord and others relates to Sanguinetti's involvement with the Situationist International, including its dissolution, as well as Sanguinetti's expulsion from France in 1971 and his writing under the pseudonym "Censor" in 1975. Writings include drafts of Sanguinetti's Prove dell'inesistenza di Censor, Rimedio a tutto, Del terrorismo e dello stato, and other works. Photographs, mostly by Sanguinetti, show fellow Situationists including Guy Debord, Mustapha Khayati, Raoul Vaneigem, and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, writings, notes, clippings, photocopies, posters, printed materials, legal papers, photographs, and digital media documenting the life and work of writer Gianfranco Sanguinetti. Correspondence with Guy Debord and others relates to Sanguinetti's involvement with the Situationist International, including its dissolution, as well as Sanguinetti's expulsion from France in 1971 and his writing under the pseudonym "Censor" in 1975. Writings include drafts of Sanguinetti's Prove dell'inesistenza di Censor, Rimedio a tutto, Del terrorismo e dello stato, and other works. Photographs, mostly by Sanguinetti, show fellow Situationists including Guy Debord, Mustapha Khayati, Raoul Vaneigem, and others.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in the order established by Gianfranco Sanguinetti and in which the collection was received from Christie's.
Sanguinetti organized the papers into fifty numbered binders. Papers have been removed from the binders, but remain organized and described in binder order.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 62 (digital media): Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Christie's on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2013.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Gianfranco Sanguinetti Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection or revisions in arrangement and description.

The following is a key to the abbreviations used in the following description, which is repurposed from the dealer descrciption: MS = manuscript; TS = typescript; L = letter; GFS = Gianfranco Sanguinetti; PH = photocopie.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Gianfranco Sanguinetti Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

bioghist.head: Gianfranco Sanguinetti
bioghist.p: Gianfranco Sanguinetti (born 1948) is an Italian writer. He was a member of the Situationist International in the 1960s and, with Guy Debord, one of two final members when it dissolved in 1972.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Preceding or preparatory documents of the Italian Section constitution. SI correspondence from January to April 1969. 95 files. MS - TS - Carbon MS/TS - 43 L MS (9 TS), from Debord including 10 unpublished + 1 telegram, 29 L GFS to Debord. Total: 43 L from Debord + 29 L to Debord. (About 65 pp. from Debord, including 10 unpublished).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Preceding or preparatory documents of the Italian Section constitution. SI correspondence from April to September 1969. 89 files. MS - TS - Carbon MS/TS - 43 L MS (9 TS), from Debord including 10 unpublished + 1 telegram, 29 L GFS to Debord. Total: 43 L from Debord + 29 L to Debord. (About 65 pp. from Debord, including 10 unpublished).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: SI correspondence from October to December 1969. 85 files + 17 files on the bombs of 1969. MS - TS - Carbon MS/TS - (14 MS + 1 TS + 1 photocopy + 1 unpublished (photocopy) from Debord - Total 17 L from Debord + 21 L GFS to Debord). (About 47 pp. from Debord, including 2 unpublished).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: SI Correspondence from January to October 1970. (Crisis and dissolution of the Italian Section.) 100 files. (9 L MS + 7 TS + 4 photocopies from Debord, 1 MS + 2 TS unpublished, Total: 23 L from Debord + 18 L GFS to Debord). (About 36 pp. from Debord, including 5 unpublished).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: SI Correspondence from October to December 1970. (Crisis and dissolution of the Italian Section.) 19 files + 1 file of the media. (9 L MS + 7 TS + 4 photocopies from Debord, 1 MS + 2 TS unpublished, Total: 23 L from Debord + 18 L GFS to Debord). (About 36 pp. from Debord, including 5 unpublished).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: SI Correspondence from January to September 1971. 100 files. (21 L MS + 8 TS + 1 photocopy from Debord + 11 unpublished, including 7 MS, 3 TS, 1 drawing of a game - Total: 41 L from Debord + 36 L GFS to Debord). (About 93 pp. from Debord, including 19 unpublished).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: SI Correspondence from September to December 1971. 70 files. (21 L MS + 8 TS + 1 photocopy from Debord + 11 unpublished, including 7 MS, 3 TS, 1 drawing of a game - Total: 41 L from Debord + 36 L GFS to Debord). (About 93 pp. from Debord, including 19 unpublished).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence Guy - Alice from January to August 1972. Dissolution of the SI. 90 files. (26 MS + 10 TS + 2 telegrams + 1 Typographic document + 2 TS and 3 telegrams unpublished - Total 44 L from Debord + 36 L GFS to Debord. (+3 pp. from Debord printed in Italian : "Sull'Architettura selvaggia.") - (About 88 pp. from Debord, including 5 unpublished).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Guy and Alice from August to December 1972. Dissolution of the SI. 30 files. (26 MS + 10 TS + 2 telegrams + 1 Typographic document + 2 TS and 3 telegrams, unpublished - Total 44 L from Debord + 36 L GFS to Debord. (+3 pp. from Debord printed in Italian : "Sull'Architettura selvaggia.") - (About 88 pp. from Debord, including 5 unpublished).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Guy, 1973. 35 files + 1 file of the media. (15 L MS + 3 TS + 2 unpublished MS from Debord - Total : 20 L from Debord + 6 L GFS to Debord). (About 37 pp. from Debord, including 4 unpublished).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence Guy - Eduardo, etc., 1974. (The letters which are missing here are in 7BIS, "Censor Scandal.") 81 files. (29 L MS - including 5 MS + 1 telegram, unpublished - and TS from Debord, 11 L GFS to Debord). (About 40 pp. from Debord, including 8 unpublished).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence Guy, 1974-1976. CENSOR Scandal. Here, the originals of my letters to Debord are also gathered from his archives, retrieved by Alice Debord in 2004. 120 files. (28 L MS and TS - including 7 MS and 3 photocopies, unpublished - from Debord, 43 L GFS to Debord). (About 55 pp. from Debord, including 13 unpublished).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: About 100 pages of letters, pamphlets, newspapers, and manifestos. Correspondence with Guy, 1977-1979 on "Du Terrorisme" and on the revolts at Rome and Bologne. Moro Affair. The edition has 39 copies of "Tenzone di Anonimo Trovatore del Secolo XIII." 78 files. (14 L MS and TS from Debord - including 1 unpublished MS - 19 to Debord). (About 23 pp. from Debord, including 1 unpublished).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Controversies surrounding the book "Du Terrorisme et de l'Etat," 1980-1984. Correspondences: 3 Typescripts of Debord (under the signatures of Lebovici, Els van Daele), J.F. Martos, Michel Prigent, Jaap Kloostermann, Van Daele, Mikis Anastassiadis, Carlos Ojeda, Roujau and Labrugere, Lebovici. Two texts of Sanguinetti from 2012 are added regarding these controversies: (1) the letter of Sanguinetti to Mustapha Khayati, 12/10/2012, and (2) "Souvenir," from Sanguinetti on the Doge. 116 files. (Note: Previously vol. 34)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including 67 American Section records and 47 Scandinavian Section records + Manifestos and pamphlets. (Note: This is from the whole correspondence exchanged between the sections, as well as personal letters between members of the sections.) 121 files. (1 MS, 3 TS, 4 photocopies, from Debord, 4 GFS). (1 p MS, 9 TS, 1 PH from Debord).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Organizational questions - Strategic Debate. 77 files. (9 TS adn 13 photocopies from Debord + 1 translation, 24 GFS). (About 15 pp. TS, 28 pp. PH, 5 pp. Translation from Debord).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Expulsion from France - Vaconsin Affair - Trap of the Police - Ministry of Internal Affairs - Termination of M. Vaconsin at the Batonnier - Paris and Bentley apartment questions. 62 files. (1 telegram + 4 MS from Debord, including 2 MS + 1 TS unpublished, 1 L to Debord from GFS). (1 telegram, 3 pp. MS, 1 PH from Debord).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: SI correspondence outside the Italian Section (1968-1970). 122 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: SI Correspondence outside the Italian Section, in Italian, French, English (1971- May 1972). 115 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: SI Correspondence outside the Italian Section, in Italian, French, English (May 1972-December 1972) plus some later letters. 45 files.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notebooks and translations MS + 3 chapters of "Traité" by Vaneigem, mimeographed + Letter editor Vallecchi, Italian translation of "La Société du Spectacle" TS orig. of Salvadori with corrections. 8 notebooks + 6 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Censor Scandal - 1 Record with 1 of the 520 copies (#149) of the original edition, numbered in monotype, of "Rapporto Veridico" with Sanguinetti's notes on the diversions and references in the book. Unpublished letter to Debord (1/7/74) in which Sanguinetti wrote the first draft of the Censor operation - One 3 pp. unpublished MS Record written by Sanguinetti and Debord with notes taken during a conversation on Censor - 7 Records with the original manuscript of the first version of the pamphlet - 1 Record with the intervention strategy and the diagram in the different phases of the scandal by Debord, unpublished. Index MS of the titles of the modified chapters by Debord - 1 Record with six pages TS of Debord to insert in the first chapter - 1 unpublished MS letter of Debord (2 pp.) with notes for the last chapter. 2 pp. unpublished TS of Debord with 3 propositions of corrections for page 3 of the preface - 2 pp. TS de Debord: "Proposition for a development apart - perhaps for the end of the pamphlet." - 7 pp. on 8 TS (with autograph corrections) of Debord to integrate in chapters I and VII - 2 pp. unpublished TS of Debord with notes to respond to journalistic follies + 2 articles of newspapers. - 3 unpublished Bristol MS tickets of Debord with citations and notes - 9 pp. printed by Mardersteig in monotype in order to serve as an example to the printer - 8 Records of 15 letters of thanks by the Italian ministry to the editor (Aldo Moro, Giulio Andreotti, Guido Carli, Bruno Visentini, Giorgio Amendola, Pietro Nenni, etc.). Agreement with Scotti Camuzzi, 1 Record with 4 pages of translation in English (Katharine Scott) of the "Préface." - 2 pp. of the book with MS notes of Sanguinetti. 2 pp. with unpublished text of Debord for Champ Libre in order to present the French edition. 49 files. (1 p. MS + 11 pp. published TS + 8 MS + 8 unpublished TS of Debord).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Complete original manuscript of "Prove dell'Inesistenza di Censor" - Prepatory notes, with 1 p., 4 Bristol MS tickets and two drawings of Europe and Italy of Debord (unpublished). Plus some letters, my deposition MS to the trial of Catanzaro. - Record of press with the news of the arrest of General Maletti and Captain La Bruin of the Secret Services after my deposition to the judge of Catanzaro. - Copy of my suppression at the France-Switzerland border (2/11/1976) + copy of "Le Monde" (2/24/1976) with the famous "Déclaration des Éditions Champ Libre," written by Debord some days after my arrest and supression at the border and published on half a page of "Monde" (on p. 7). 34 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Press on the Censor Scandal (1975-1976). 99 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: About 300 pp. of MS and TS articles for the first of the "Internazionale Situazionista" review, (1969) + corrected printing proofs, diverted advertisements, illustrations. 24 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bringing together the Situationist or pro-Situationist leaflets and small editions between 1968 and 1980 in several languages, including drafts of manifestos.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection of TS documents and prints related to the different movements between 1968 and 1982 in Italian and French. 33 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Posters and leaflets printed in several languages (French, Italian, Arabic, Spanish, English, Polish, Swedish, Greek) 1968-1974. 79 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Complete unpublished manuscript of "Rimedio a Tutto" (of GFS - 1977). XV Chapters. About 600 pp. 28 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original corrected TS of "Rimedio a Tutto" (except chapters III and X : Chapter X, together with the "Préface," the "Avertissement de l'Auteur" and "Dédicace aux mauvais ouvriers," was published in the book : "Del Terrorismo e dello Stato, 1979). 15 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Carbon copies of the TS of "Rimedio a Tutto, " including chapter X but not chapters III, VIII, IX, XII. 14 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sanguinetti, "Del Terrorismo e dello Stato," carbon copy: 1) Index, 2) Warning, 3) Foreward (1 p. missing), 4) text, 5) Preface to the French Edition (70 pp.) + 6) Excerpts of english translation (15 pp.) + the same text, photocopies with notes of the anarchist Joe Fallisi (39 pp.). (Total = 124 pp.). 7 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: MS and TS, Sanguinetti, "Del Terrorismo e dello Stato" (Original manuscript, MS draft + Preface to the French edition). About 200 pp. 17 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sanguinetti, "Del Terrorismo e dello Stato," corrected proofs (about 180 pp.). 5 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Translation: "Du Terrorism et de l'Etat" - Typescript copy. French translation of JF Martos + Spanish translation of Carlos Ojeda TS + MS (About 300 pp. + including 125pp MS.). 5 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manifestos, leaflets and printed documents of the 1970s (in Italian and French). (Note: We put in this volume the binder formerly entitled 27 BIS.) 73 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: (Italian, English, French) Small, rare editions, years '70/'80. 39 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original carbon typescript with MS corrections of Debord of "La Véritable Scission dans l'Internationale." (It is missing p. 37). + 1 p. MS of Debord's notes. 2 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original corrected unpublished Italian translation typscript of "La Vera Scissione nell'Internazionale. 100 pp. 2 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Film project on Censor (written by Sanguinetti with the collaboration of Debord). Two editions of Censor + Photocopies of the script of the film "La Société du Spectacle with notes and diversions of Debord. 12 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: MS original of Sanguinetti's unpublished pamphlet against the anti-terrorism Prosecutor Pier Luigi Vigna after the killing of Aldo Moro: "Del Modo tenuto da Pier Luigi Vigna, magistrato fiorentino nel frabbricare l'accusa di Terrorismo contro Sanguinetti e altri," 1979. About 60 pp. 7 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Revolts and movements of 1977 at Rome and Bologna. 1 MS of Sanguinetti's notes. Unedited book project. Correspondences. Manifestos. Leaflets. Original unpublished photos. Media files. 25 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Revolts and movements of 1977 at Rome and Bologna. 1 MS of Sanguinetti's notes. Unedited book project. Correspondences. Manifestos. Leaflets. Original unpublished photos. Media files. 1 oversized file.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: International press on Sanguinetti starting from 1971. 62 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Police, Judiciary, Military documents (1960-1983). 1 telegram from Debord (published) and 2 unpublished photocopies (including the originals in Binder 11). 69 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Unpublished correspondence, original MS and TS, with the bankers Raffaele Mattioli, Enrico Cuccia, and others, and with the lawyer Ariberto Magnoli (1971-1999). Plus documentation. 110 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: MS and TS unpublished correspondence of GFS with the revolutionary Riccardo d'Este, in prison for armed struggle, between 1981 and 1986. Unpublished. 61 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Alice Becker (1995-2004) and correspondance photocopies with Debord in view of the poblication. About 500 pp. + original correspondence with Alice Becker. 26 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: More than 150 original unpublished photographs, much of which are single-copy, taken mostly by GFS (except where GFS is present), with the Situationists and their friends starting from 1969. In these photos one finds Guy Debord, Alice Becker, Mustapha Khayati, Hakima Berrada, René Viénet, Raoul Vaneigem, Fatimah, J. V. Martin, Gianfranco Sanguinetti, Connie Occhialini, Celeste, Christian Sébastiani, Paolo Salvadori, Claudio Pavan, Maria Cristina Michiara, René Riesel, John Horelick, Jane, Tony Verlaan, Robert Chasse, Bruce Ellwell, Eduardo Rothe, Techi, Alain Chevalier, François de Beaulieu, Patrick Cheval, Angéline Neveu, Mario Masanzanica, Rocco Muzio, Teresa Mattei, Françoise Sullivan, Gerhard Weiss, Magdalena Michels and others. They were taken at Milan, Venice, Bologna, Florence, Siena, Monteriggioni, S. Gimignano, Greve in Chianti, S. Andrea in Percussina, etc. On the back of the photos there are notes with the names. At the end of the file are about thirty photos of documentation of the archival work and of subsequent photos. (Attached to this binder is a disk on which more than 250 photos were scanned- some of which are in double.) 41 files.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: MS and TS. 1)"Internationale Situationniste" #13, unpublished. 10 files with articles (1970/71) (66 pp.). "Avertissement," unpublished of Debord (14 pp.) original carbon TS with corrections. 2) Unpublished notes and manuscripts of GFS (1968-1973). 3) Eduardo Rothe. 2 files. 1 notebook with unpublished handwritten MS book, illustrated with original drawings: "La Coherencia Armada - Manual de Tecnicas Insurrecionales." 100 pp. + 1 album of subversive comics, unpublished, illustrated of original drawings (of Rothe) A4 format, full page colored. 4) Raoul Vaneigem, TS photocopy: "Toast aux Ouvriers révolutionnaires" - October 1972. 5) GFS - "Le Lotte di Classe in Italia 1969-1972." Unpublished MS and TS (about 120 pp.). 6) GFS - "Gli Operai d'Italia e la Rivolta di Reggio Calabria." Original MS (22 pp.), TS + prints of proofs. 7) Mustapha Khayati - "Della Miseria nell'ambiente studentesco" (proof sheets for the edition of the "Estremismo coerente dei Situazionisti"). 8) GFS - unpublished MS pamphlet (unfinished) : "Soluzioni tecniche di Questioni sociali e politiche. Un Contributo alla Strategia e alla Tattica dei Servizi di Protezione dello Stato. Manuale pratico ad uso dello Stato Maggiore." (about 22 pp.) 9) Correspondence Michele Bernstein, Ralph Rumney. 49 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: MS and TS. 10) Holland Affair - Attali - Bercoff - Censor plagiarism 1982-1989. 11) "Proletari non illudiamoci : Toni Negri e' innocente," 1979. Pamphlet project. 14 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Murder of Gérard Lebovici, media files + letter of Jacques Philipponneau + pamphlet "Les mots et les Balles." 25 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: American media. 11 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pseudo-Berlinguer Scandal - Unpublished GFS preface to "Lettere agli Eretici." Pamphlet against Giulio Bollati di Saint-Pierre. Correspondence with P.F. Ghisleni. 60 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Media on the Situationists. 35 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publishers and typographers, correspondences. 88 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sanguinetti - manuscripts and typescripts 1964-1967 - unpublished. 17 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sanguinetti - manuscripts and typescripts - unpublished GFS. 45 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addendum I. This folder is not ordered. 24 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addendum II. This binder is not ordered. 13 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addendum III.

did.unittitle: Hard drive containing scans of the collection

accessrestrict.p: Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
